description: The unique key given to records of drug dispensings or administrations for a person. Refer to the ETL for how duplicate drugs during the same visit were handled.
comment: Primary Key for the DRUG_EXPOSURE table

description: The PERSON_ID of the PERSON for whom the drug dispensing or administration is recorded. This may be a system generated code.
comment: Foreign Key: PERSON.person_id

description: The DRUG_CONCEPT_ID field is recommended for primary use in analyses, and must be used for network studies. This is the standard concept mapped from the source concept id which represents a drug product or molecule otherwise introduced to the body.
comment: Foreign Key: CONCEPT.drug_concept_id

description: Use this date to determine the start date of the drug record.
comment: Valid entries include a prescription start date, fill date, or administration date.
Set the time to midnight (00:00:0000) if no time is specified.

description: The DRUG_EXPOSURE_END_DATE denotes the day the drug exposure ended for the patient.
comment: Infer end date from start date and duration if not explicitly available.
Set the time to midnight (00:00:0000) if no time is specified.

description: This is the end date of the drug exposure as it appears in the source data, if it is given.
comment: Put the end date or discontinuation date as it appears from the source data, or leave blank if unavailable.

description: You can use the TYPE_CONCEPT_ID to delineate between prescriptions written vs. prescriptions dispensed vs. medication history vs. patient-reported exposure, etc.
comment: Foreign Key: CONCEPT.drug_type_concept_id

description: The reason a person stopped a medication as it is represented in the source. Reasons include regimen completed, changed, removed, etc.
comment: Valid ETL choice to leave blank if information is unavailable.

description: This is only filled in when the record is coming from a prescription written. This field is meant to represent intended refills at the time of the prescription.
comment: Refills intended at time of prescription.
Quantity of drug dispensed or administered, converted to correct units if necessary.

description: The number of days of supply of the medication as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record.
comment: Leave empty if not available in source data. Negative values are not allowed.

description: This is the verbatim instruction for the drug as written by the provider.
comment: Written out instructions verbatim from the source.
Foreign Key: CONCEPT.route_concept_id
Lot number of drug exposure, if available.

description: The Provider associated with drug record, e.g. the provider who wrote the prescription or the provider who administered the drug.
comment: Foreign Key: PROVIDER.provider_id

description: The Visit during which the drug was prescribed, administered or dispensed.
comment: Foreign Key: VISIT_OCCURRENCE.visit_occurrence_id

description: The VISIT_DETAIL record during which the drug exposure occurred.
comment: Foreign Key: VISIT_DETAIL.visit_detail_id

description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the drug exposure that occurred. For example, this could be an NDC or Gemscript code.
comment: Verbatim value from source data.

description: This is the concept representing the drug source value and may not necessarily be standard.
comment: Foreign Key: CONCEPT.drug_source_concept_id

description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the drug route.
comment: Verbatim value indicating the drug route from source data.

description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the dose unit of the drug given.
comment: Verbatim value of dose unit from source data.
